<JD_START>
Job Title: Janitor II

Location: Butte, MT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description:

This position is responsible for performing general housekeeping tasks to maintain the facility and associated buildings in a sanitary, safe, and attractive condition and to meet hospital and Joint Commission standards.

Scope

As a Janitor II you need to know how to:

Maintain all floor surfaces.

Dispose of all infectious and non-infectious waste.

Be responsible for all furniture moving and set-up.

Maintain all wall and ceiling surfaces, including lights.

Maintain all entrances.

Clean patient rooms and common areas.

Dust all areas both high and low.

Stock supplies for cart and room as required (including both laundry and housekeeper supplies).

Demonstrate proficiency in the cleaning of beds and the Alaris IV Pump.

Wash soiled linen.

Sort clean linen.

Fold clean linen and place in proper storage areas.

Feed linen into mangle and fold on the mangle.

Assemble unit packs.

Deliver linen to inpatient rooms and ancillary departments.

Minimum Qualifications

 High School Diploma or equivalent, preferred- Current Friends and Family Basic Life Support (BLS) certification, required within six (6) months of hire- Basic computer skills, required- Related experience or training, preferred

Physical Requirements:

Carrying, Climbing, Crawling, Hearing/Listening, Lifting, Manual Dexterity, Pulling/Pushing, Seeing, Speaking, Squatting/Kneeling, Standing, Walking

Anticipated job posting close date:

06/29/2024

Location:

St James Hospital

Work City:

Butte

Work State:

Montana

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

The hourly range for this position is listed below. Actual hourly rate dependent upon experience.

$16.24 - $21.92

We care about your well-being – mind, body, and spirit – which is why we provide our caregivers a generous benefits package that covers a wide range of programs to foster a sustainable culture of wellness that encompasses living healthy, happy, secure, connected, and engaged.

Learn more about our comprehensive benefits packages for our Idaho, Nevada, and Utah based caregivers, and for our Colorado, Montana, and Kansas based caregivers; and our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Intermountain Health is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
